article.headline: Pepperdine 95, Lipscomb 74
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Glen McGowan scored 24 points to lead Pepperdine to a 95-74 victory over Lipscomb on Friday. The Waves (3-4) won easily despite being called for four technical fouls, three on coach Paul Westphal, who was ejected from the game. Westphal was upset that Lipscomb was allowed to run an in-bounds play late in the second half before his team was ready to play. Pepperdine also got 19 points from Alex Acker, 15 from Shaun Davis and 14 from Terrance Johnson. Lipscomb (1-5) was led by James Poindexter with 30 points. Russell Hankins added 15 for the Bisons. Pepperdine trailed early but took the lead midway through the first half on 3-pointer by Johnson and never trailed again. Lipscomb twice cut the lead to 10 in the second half, the last time after the spate of technicals with about six minutes left, but could never get the deficit into single digits.
